Kural_Info.Tamil_Text: அறிவுடையார் எல்லா முடையார் அறிவிலார் என்னுடைய ரேனும் இலர்.
Kural_Info.English_Meaning: Those who possess wisdom, possess every thing; those who have not wisdom, whatever they may possess, have nothing.

Layered_Composition.Foreground: A split composition. On the left, a wise person ('அறிவுடையார்') stands in an empty space, holding only a single, glowing seed of knowledge. From this one seed, an entire, vibrant, prosperous universe is shown sprouting and growing around them. They possess all things ('எல்லாமுடையார்').
Layered_Composition.Midground: On the right, an unwise person ('அறிவிலார்') sits in a vault filled to the ceiling with gold, jewels, and countless material possessions ('என்னுடையரேனும்').
Layered_Composition.Background: Despite their material wealth, the unwise person's vault is shown to be a dark, lifeless, and empty void. Their possessions are crumbling into dust, revealing that they truly possess nothing of substance ('இலர்').

Art_Direction.Subject_and_Action: The wise possess everything because they have the source of all things (knowledge). The fool possesses nothing, because their material wealth is without substance.
Art_Direction.Symbolic_Motifs: The seed of knowledge creating a universe is the metaphor for possessing everything. The crumbling treasure in a void is the metaphor for possessing nothing.
Art_Direction.Mood_and_Emotion: Paradoxical, profound, contrasting true wealth with material illusion.
Art_Direction.Lighting_and_Color: The wise person's side is full of vibrant color and the life-giving light from the sprouting universe. The fool's side is dark, with the cold, dead glint of metal turning to grey dust.

Technical_Cues.Camera: A balanced, diptych shot that presents the stark contrast between the two states of being.
Technical_Cues.Resolution: 8K, with magical realism effects for the sprouting universe and crumbling gold.

Negative_Prompt: a sad wise person, a happy fool, solid gold, text artifacts, cartoonish.
